description: From Middle English grills, grilles, of unknown origin. Cognate with Scots grils, grissill, girls (“young salmon”). Compare English grawl, Scots grawl, graulse (“young salmon, grilse”).

entries.meaning: A young salmon after its first return from the sea.
examples: In our own tongue salmon are fry as babies, parr as children, smolt as adolescents, and grilse as adults.
